segments.advisor_message: So, based on your current loans, I think it might be a good idea to consolidate them. Have you considered that? It could simplify your monthly payments.
segments.client_message: Consolidation, huh? I dunno... I mean, what if it ends up costing me more in the long run? Like, I currently have a personal loan and a car finance, plus my mortgage, right? What's the catch here?

segments.advisor_message: I understand your concern. With consolidation, you're actually looking at lower monthly costs, and your interest rate could be reduced too, depending on the provider. Let’s say, if we could get a special rate, it might help a lot!
segments.client_message: Okay, but what about the outstanding values on my loans? The personal loan's about ten grand and my car finance is another five. If I switch things up, will I really save money?
